result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley W. Henson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons, except for during his military service.

Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program or similar programming or approved by Agent.   
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
No contact with R.M.H., unless have consent of R.M.H and Agent, then no abusive contact.
Expungement if successfully completes, with proper attitude and recommended by the Agent.

records.addlTxt:
10:27 a.m.   Defendant Harley W. Henson in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence: 18 mo Probation: Maintain full-time employment.   Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program or similar programing or approved by Agent.   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.   Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. No violent or abusive contact with R.M.H. Pay costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
State provides a victim statement and has complied with victim compliance.
ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs in part with joint recommendation, request to be allowed weapons as in the military and asks for expungement. 

BY THE COURT:**********Probation***
I/S Sentence: 90 days jail - stayed
18 mo Probation: 
Conditions:
Maintain full-time employment.   
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program or similar programming or approved by Agent.   
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons, except for during his military service.   
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
No contact with R.M.H., unless have consent of R.M.H and Agent, then no abusive contact.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge
Expungement if successfully completes, with proper attitude and recommended by the Agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Harley W. Henson
Current: 627 1/2 Monomonie St, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2015)
Prior: 2117 Mcculloch Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and wants contact filed by: Tina Stroik
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Harley W. Henson in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel Atty Halverson

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Rhoda Henson and Tina Stroik unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
***03-13-2015:   CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and wants contact filed by: Tina Stroik

Clerk is Shelley P
DA #15PT203
11:06 a.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant of right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $200.00 with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: February 16, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2.
